comments.body: why not to use default script names and remove these lines?
Mainly because this is a multi-output recipe, and you need to distinguish which script gets used for which output...

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +61,65 @@  - name: ray-core
    script: build-core.sh  # [not win]
    script: build-core.bat  # [win]
    requirements:
      build:

comments.body: Could we add a comment here which deps are missing on windows?

It has nothing to do with deps, it's autoscaler itself not working on Windows.
It relies on having POSIX-compliant `ssh` and `rsync` binaries.

If you enable native `ssh` on Windows it _seems_ to start working, but eventually fails somewhere in the internals (note that I have last checked that with Ray 0.8.7, but I highly doubt things changed much in 1.0).

Reference: https://github.com/ray-project/ray/issues/9114

I have added a comment section to the recipe to reflect that.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +212,216 @@      # neither of which are available on Windows; they are in WSL, but that is
      # effectively a Linux version from conda point of view
      skip: True  # [win]
    requirements:
      host:
